sentence.Network_en: Adult education is run in cooperation with the extra-mural departments of the universities.
sentence.Network_cn: 成人教育是和大学对外教学部合办的。

sentence.Network_en: One of the walls enclosing the park is decorated with a huge mural showing Hollywood stars.
sentence.Network_cn: 公园的一堵围墙上装饰着好莱坞明星的巨幅壁画.

sentence.Network_en: I took my first extra-mural course in 1948 in Coventry, even though I was working in Birmingham.
sentence.Network_cn: 1948年我在考文垂第一次上校外课，虽然当时我在伯明翰工作。

list.abs: ...认出灰白与褐色相间的条纹状结构（图3-8）。发生于心腔内、动脉粥样硬化溃疡部位或动脉瘤内的混合血栓，可称为附壁血栓（mural thrombus）。发生于左心房内的血栓，由于心房的收缩和舒张，混合血栓呈球状。镜下混合血栓主要由淡红色无结构的呈分支.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French, from Latin muralis, from murus 'wall'. The adjective was first used in mural crown; later (mid 16th cent.) the sense 'placed or executed on a wall' arose, reflected in the current noun use (dating from the early 20th cent.)

entry.def: A mural is a picture painted on a wall.

means.word_mean: 1. a painting that is applied to a wall surface
